block_comment: This block deals with the transmission end frame signal (`TxEndFrm`) in a communication system. Upon every positive clock edge on `MTxClk` or a reset condition (`Reset`), the signal `TxEndFrm` is reset. In normal conditions, if an end frame condition (`Flop & TxEndFrm`), an abort event (`TxAbort`), or a retry query (`TxRetry_q`) is observed, `TxEndFrm` is reset again. However, if the `Flop` and `LastWord` indicate the end of the data package, `TxEndFrm` becomes dependent on the number of valid bytes left (`TxValidBytesLatched`), aligning `TxEndFrm` with the byte count data (`TxByteCnt`).
